title: Pro-Palestine mega rally held peacefully on Saturday, say police
summary:
The ‘Himpunan Mega Demi Palestin’ rally in the capital on Saturday was held peacefully, said Kuala Lumpur police chief Datuk Allaudeen Abdul Majid.

Allaudeen said there were no untoward incidents during the procession, which started in front of the Menara Tabung Haji on Jalan Tun Razak, and ended at Padang Merbok on Jalan Parlimen.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 2): The ‘Himpunan Mega Demi Palestin’ rally in the capital on Saturday was held peacefully, said Kuala Lumpur police chief Datuk Allaudeen Abdul Majid.

Allaudeen said there were no untoward incidents during the procession, which started in front of the Menara Tabung Haji on Jalan Tun Razak, and ended at Padang Merbok on Jalan Parlimen.

"The police stationed sufficient personnel to control the situation during the rally, and until th

title: Rumah Mesra Rakyat prices not affected by SST hike, says SPNB
summary: Syarikat Perumahan Negara Bhd (SPNB) assures that prices of Rumah Mesra Rakyat (RMR) will not be hiked, following the rise in the sales and service tax (SST) to 8% effective from Friday.
content:
BATU GAJAH (March 2): Syarikat Perumahan Negara Bhd (SPNB) assures that prices of Rumah Mesra Rakyat (RMR) will not be hiked, following the rise in the sales and service tax (SST) to 8% effective from Friday.

Acting chief executive officer Zahanuddin Kamarudin explained that this is due to RMR projects not encompassing the consultation aspect, a critical element in terms of construction typically seen in private developer projects.

"Other developers ma

title: Bersatu amends party constitution to expel rogue elected reps, Muhyiddin says by-elections to follow
summary: Bersatu's extraordinary general meeting on Saturday approved amendments to the party's constitution on the cessation of membership of elected representatives who support any party contrary to Bersatu’s interests.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 2): Bersatu's extraordinary general meeting on Saturday approved amendments to the party's constitution on the cessation of membership of elected representatives who support any party contrary to Bersatu’s interests.

The amendments involve three articles under Clause 10 of the Bersatu constitution relating to the termination and dismissal of party members.

The unanimous approval of the amendments w

title: Be value creators, not value adders, Rafizi tells Bumiputera middle class
summary:
The Ministry of Economy has called on the Bumiputera middle class to change their role to value-creating from value-adding to help the national economy.

Economy Minister Mohd Rafizi Ramli said the empowerment of Bumiputeras will only be successful if they have control and ownership of the economy.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (March 2): The Ministry of Economy has called on the Bumiputera middle class to change their role to value-creating from value-adding to help the national economy.

Economy Minister Mohd Rafizi Ramli said the empowerment of Bumiputeras will only be successful if they have control and ownership of the economy.

He suggested that Bumiputeras who had been successful in their respective businesses become financiers for Bumiputera-owned start-up companie

title: PM announces RM1b fund to foster Bumiputera entrepreneurs
summary: The government is set to allocate a substantial fund of RM1 billion to foster a new generation of Bumiputera entrepreneurs in high-growth sectors, to be managed by government-linked investment companies (GLCs), said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (March 2): The government is set to allocate a substantial fund of RM1 billion to foster a new generation of Bumiputera entrepreneurs in high-growth sectors, to be managed by government-linked investment companies (GLCs), said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

This initiative comes in response to calls for the establishment of a Bumiputera Transformation Acceleration Fund during the three-day Bumiputera Economic Congress (KEB), which started on Thursday.

title: Govt aims to fortify TVET in agriculture to ensure food security, says Mat Sabu
summary: The government aims to fortify the technical and vocational education and training (TVET) programme in the agriculture sector by increasing the number of graduates to ensure the nation's food security.
content:
SERDANG (March 2): The government aims to fortify the technical and vocational education and training (TVET) programme in the agriculture sector by increasing the number of graduates to ensure the nation's food security.

Agriculture and Food Security Minister Datuk Seri Mohamad Sabu, who is also known as Mat Sabu, said that currently, there are only an estimated 600 graduates in the sector each year.

He emphasised that the ministry aims

title: Govt agrees in principle to implement home detention for prisoners, says Saifuddin
summary: The government has agreed in principle to implement the licensed release of prisoners, through home detention, for prisoners serving jail time of four years and below, as an effort to reduce overcrowding in prisons.
content:
PUNCAK BORNEO (March 2): The government has agreed in principle to implement the licensed release of prisoners, through home detention, for prisoners serving jail time of four years and below, as an effort to reduce overcrowding in prisons.

Home Minister Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail said that his ministry is currently in the process of examining the implementation method from the point of view of relevant legal provisions, to ensure whether the existing laws and regulations need to be enacted

title: Malaysia Healthcare Travel Council denies lack of direction
summary:
The Malaysia Healthcare Travel Council (MHTC), a government agency under the Ministry of Health, has denied allegations of lack of direction at the company.

In a statement on Saturday, the agency referred to news published by a local news organisation titled “Malaysia Healthcare Travel Council in ‘serious’ condition with massive resignations, ‘lack of direction’”.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 2): The Malaysia Healthcare Travel Council (MHTC), a government agency under the Ministry of Health, has denied allegations of lack of direction at the company.

In a statement on Saturday, the agency referred to an article published by a local news organisation titled “Malaysia Healthcare Travel Council in ‘serious’ condition with massive resignations, ‘lack of direction’”.

title: Miti sees 'golden opportunity' for second surge in Malaysian economy
summary: Political stability, far-sighted economic policies, and the green transition provide a golden opportunity for a second surge in the country's economy after the first jump made in the early 1990s.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 2): Political stability, far-sighted economic policies, and the green transition provide a golden opportunity for a second surge in the country's economy after the first jump made in the early 1990s.

Deputy Investment, Trade and Industry Minister Liew Chin Tong said the competition between China and the US had pushed investments into the Southeast Asian region, and that Malaysia plays an important role in attracting investors.

title: CPO futures likely to trade lower on profit-taking next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The crude palm oil (CPO) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is likely to trade lower next week on profit-taking as market players await the outcome of the international palm oil conference.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The crude palm oil (CPO) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is likely to trade lower next week on profit-taking as market players await the outcome of the international palm oil conference.

Interband group of companies senior palm oil trader Jim Teh said investors and traders will look forward to getting clues and cues from experts on their opinions for the palm oil prices and the market outlook.

title: The Week Ahead: Attention on OPR, decisions on  Daim and Isa Samad’s court cases
summary: The central focus this week will be Bank Negara Malaysia’s monetary policy decision on Thursday.
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on March 4, 2024 - March 10, 2024

The central focus this week will be Bank Negara Malaysia’s monetary policy decision on Thursday. 

There will also be interest in the US and China’s latest trade data for a gauge of how the world’s largest and second-largest economies are faring.

title: Preparing Capital A for take-off + service tax change surprises industry
summary: Co-founder Tan Sri Tony Fernandes intends to monetise the AirAsia brand by injecting it into a US-based special purpose acquisition company (SPAC) — an unorthodox move that could pave the way for the lifting of Capital A Bhd out of the distressed Practice Note 17 (PN17) status.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 2): Co-founder Tan Sri Tony Fernandes intends to monetise the AirAsia brand by injecting it into a US-based special purpose acquisition company (SPAC) — an unorthodox move that could pave the way for the lifting of Capital A Bhd out of the distressed Practice Note 17 (PN17) status.

Capital A is also selling its aviation business to AirAsia X Bhd (AAX) as the monetisation of the brand alone would not be enough to lift it out of PN17 status.

title: Oil notches weekly gains ahead of Opec+ decision
summary: Oil prices rose 2% on Friday and posted weekly gains as traders awaited an Opec+ decision on supply agreements for the second quarter while also weighing fresh US, European and Chinese economic data.
content:
Brent futures for May settled US$1.64 higher, or 2%, at US$83.55 a barrel. US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) for April rose US$1.71, or 2.19%, to US$79.97 a barrel.

NEW YORK: Oil prices rose 2% on Friday and posted weekly gains as traders awaited an Opec+ decision on supply agreements for the second quarter while also weighing fresh US, European and Chinese economic data.

title: Wall St Week Ahead: US value stocks draw bargain hunters
summary: As fervour for artificial intelligence sweeps Wall Street, some investors are seeking bargains in more conventional areas of the stock market.
content:
Value stocks have largely been left behind as AI put a charge into their growth-focused peers.

NEW YORK: As fervour for artificial intelligence sweeps Wall Street, some investors are seeking bargains in more conventional areas of the stock market.

title: S&P 500 and Nasdaq close at fresh records
summary: US stocks rose on Friday, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq closing at record highs, as technology stocks rallied on continued enthusiasm for artificial intelligence, with further support from declining Treasury yields.
content:
The Dow rose 90.99 points, or 0.23% , to 39,087.38, the S&P 500 gained 40.81 points, or 0.80%, to 5,137.08 and the Nasdaq gained 183.02 points, or 1.14%, to 16,274.94.

NEW YORK: US stocks rose on Friday, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq closing at record highs, as technology stocks rallied on continued enthusiasm for artificial intelligence, with further support from declining Treasury yields.

title: China’s factory activity shrinks for fifth month
summary: China's manufacturing activity in February contracted for a fifth straight month, an official factory survey showed yesterday, raising the pressure on policymakers to roll out further stimulus measures as factory owners struggle for orders.
content:
The official manufacturing purchasing managers’ index fell to 49.1 in February from 49.2 in January. — Reuters

CHINA’S manufacturing activity in February contracted for a fifth straight month, an official factory survey showed yesterday, raising the pressure on policymakers to roll out further stimulus measures as factory owners struggle for orders.

title: Timber furniture sales cool as demand softens in US, Europe
summary: Plantation Industries and Commodities Minister Datuk Seri Johari Abdul Ghani foresees Malaysia becoming a global player in the timber and timber-products industry.
content:
Johari said the furniture industry is the most dynamic downstream activity in the timber value chain.

KUALA LUMPUR: Plantation Industries and Commodities Minister Datuk Seri Johari Abdul Ghani foresees Malaysia becoming a global player in the timber and timber-products industry.

title: Firms boost gas activity in S-E Asia
summary: Energy companies are ramping up exploration activities in South-East Asia to boost natural gas output and meet long-term demand growth, drawn by recent discoveries and improved investment policies, company executives and analysts say.
content:
Malaysia and Indonesia have recently seen successful upstream discoveries following years of underinvestment in the sector since the 2015 oil price crash. — Reuters
